titles.ar: باب أَنَّهُ لَا يَتَوَارَثُ الْحُرُّ وَ الْعَبْدُ
titles.en: Chapter 41 – They shall not inherit, the free and the slave (each other)

titles.ar: باب مَنْ يُتْرَكُ مِنَ الْوَرَثَةِ بَعْضُهُمْ مُسْلِمُونَ وَ بَعْضُهُمْ مُشْرِكُونَ
titles.en: Chapter 39 – The one who leaves the inheritors, some of them being Muslims and some of them being Polytheists

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/219)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: كَانَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ فِي الرَّجُلِ الْحُرِّ يَمُوتُ وَ لَهُ أُمٌّ مَمْلُوكَةٌ قَالَ تُشْتَرَى مِنْ مَالِ ابْنِهَا ثُمَّ تُعْتَقُ ثُمَّ يُوَرِّثُهَا .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father and Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad and Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazal Bin Shazaan altogether, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hisham Bin Salim, from Suleyman Bin Khalid,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> was saying regarding the free man who died and for him what a mother who was a slave. He said: ‘She should be bought from the wealth of her son, then emancipated (liberated), then she would inherit it’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father and Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad and Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan from all from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Hisham ibn Salim from Sulayman ibn Khalid who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that ’ Amir al-Mu’minin, about the case of a free man who dies leaving behind his mother who is owned by someone, has said that she is bought with money from the legacy of her son, then is set free and then she is made to inherit him.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/220)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي نَجْرَانَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ فِي رَجُلٍ تُوُفِّيَ وَ تَرَكَ مَالًا وَ لَهُ أُمٌّ مَمْلُوكَةٌ قَالَ تُشْتَرَى أُمُّهُ وَ تُعْتَقُ ثُمَّ يُدْفَعُ إِلَيْهَا بَقِيَّةُ الْمَالِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Abu Najran, from Abdullah Bin Sinan who said,

‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying regarding a man who died and left wealth, and for him was a mother who was a slave. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘His mother should be bought and emancipated (with the son’s legacy) then the remainder of the wealth should be handed over to her’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn abu Najran from ‘Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has narrated the following: “About the case of a man who dies leaving behind a certain amount of assets and a mother who is owned by someone, I once heard abu ’Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, saying, ‘His mother is bought, then the rest of the legacy is given to her.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/220)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا مَاتَ الرَّجُلُ وَ تَرَكَ أَبَاهُ وَ هُوَ مَمْلُوكٌ أَوْ أُمَّهُ وَ هِيَ مَمْلُوكَةٌ وَ الْمَيِّتُ حُرٌّ اشْتُرِيَ مِمَّا تَرَكَ أَبُوهُ أَوْ قَرَابَتُهُ وَ وَرِثَ مَا بَقِيَ مِنَ الْمَالِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Hassan Bin Ali, from Ibn Bukeyr, from one of our companions,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘When the man dies and leaves his father and he is a slave, or his mother and she is a slave, and the deceased is a free man, his father or his relatives be bought from what is left (the legacy), and they would inherit the remainder of the wealth’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Hassan ibn Ali from ibn Bukayr from certain persons of our people who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘When a man dies leaving behind his father who is owned by someone or his mother who is owned by someone and the deceased is free, with his legacy, his father or relative is bought who then is made to inherit the remaining of the legacy.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/220)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) الرَّجُلُ يَمُوتُ وَ لَهُ ابْنٌ مَمْلُوكٌ قَالَ يُشْتَرَى وَ يُعْتَقُ ثُمَّ يُدْفَعُ إِلَيْهِ مَا بَقِيَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Jameel Bin Darraj who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The man died, and for him was a son who was a slave’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘He should be bought and emancipated (liberated), then the remainder of what is left to be handed over to him’.
en.sarwar: 4. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Jamil ibn Darraj who has narrated the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a man who dies and leaves behind a son who is owned by someone. He (the Imam) said, ‘His son is bought, set free and the rest of the legacy is given to him.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/220)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنِ ابْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: كَانَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ فِي الرَّجُلِ الْحُرِّ يَمُوتُ وَ لَهُ أُمٌّ مَمْلُوكَةٌ قَالَ تُشْتَرَى مِنْ مَالِ ابْنِهَا ثُمَّ تُعْتَقُ ثُمَّ يُوَرِّثُهَا .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazl Bin Shazaan, from Safwan, from Ibn Muskan, from Suleyman Bin Khalid,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> was saying regarding the free man who died, and for him was a mother who was a slave, he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘She should be bought from the wealth of her son, then emancipated (liberated), then she would inherit it (the remainder)’.
en.sarwar: 5. Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan from Safwan from ibn Muskan from Sulayman ibn Khalid who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that about the case of a free man who dies and leaves behind his mother who is owned by someone, Amir al-Mu’minin would say, ‘She is bought with the legacy of her son, then is set free and made to inherit her son.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/220)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ طَلْحَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ تَرَكَ مَالًا كَثِيراً وَ تَرَكَ أُمّاً مَمْلُوكَةً وَ أُخْتاً مَمْلُوكَةً قَالَ تُشْتَرَيَانِ مِنْ مَالِ الْمَيِّتِ ثُمَّ تُعْتَقَانِ وَ تُوَرَّثَانِ قُلْتُ أَ رَأَيْتَ إِنْ أَبَى أَهْلُ الْجَارِيَةِ كَيْفَ يُصْنَعُ قَالَ لَيْسَ لَهُمْ ذَلِكَ وَ يُقَوَّمَانِ قِيمَةَ عَدْلٍ ثُمَّ يُعْطَى مَا لَهُمْ عَلَى قَدْرِ الْقِيمَةِ
قُلْتُ أَ رَأَيْتَ لَوْ أَنَّهُمَا اشْتُرِيَا ثُمَّ أُعْتِقَا ثُمَّ وَرِثَاهُ مِنْ بَعْدُ مَنْ كَانَ يَرِثُهُمَا قَالَ يَرِثُهُمَا مَوَالِي ابْنِهِمَا لِأَنَّهُمَا اشْتُرِيَا مِنْ مَالِ الِابْنِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Muhammad Bin Ja’far, from Abdullah Bin Talha,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about a man who died and left a lot of wealth, and left a mother who was a slave, and a sister who was a slave. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘They should be bought from the wealth of the deceased, and they would both inherit (the remainder)’. I said, ‘What is your<sup>asws</sup> view if the people (owner) of the slaves refuse, how should it be dealt with?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘That is not for them (to refuse), and they would both be evaluated with a just price, then they (masters) would be given what is for them in accordance with the price’.

I said, ‘What is your<sup>asws</sup> view if they are both bought, then emancipated (liberated), then inherit him, who would be the ones who would be inheriting the two of them afterwards?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘They would both be inherited by the guardians of their son (the deceased) because they had both been bought from the wealth of the son’.
en.sarwar: 6. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Muhammad ibn Ja‘far from ‘Abd Allah ibn Talhah who has narrated the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a man who dies leaving behind a large amount of assets, a mother and a sister who are owned by someone. He (the Imam) said, ‘They are bought with the assets of the deceased, set free and made to inherit him.’ I then asked, ‘What happens if the people of the slave-girl refuse?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘They cannot do so. They are appraised fairly, then their fairly appraised value is paid.’ I then asked, ‘What happens if they are bought, set free then made to inherit the deceased; if they die who will inherit them?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘The Mawali (relatives) of her son will inherit them because they were bought with the legacy of the son.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/221)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قَضَى أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الرَّجُلِ يَمُوتُ وَ لَهُ أُمٌّ مَمْلُوكَةٌ وَ لَهُ مَالٌ أَنْ تُشْتَرَى أُمُّهُ مِنْ مَالِهِ وَ تُدْفَعَ إِلَيْهَا بَقِيَّةُ الْمَالِ إِذَا لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ ذُو قَرَابَةٍ لَهُمْ سَهْمٌ فِي الْكِتَابِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Mahboub, from Abdullah Bin Sinan,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> judged regarding the man who died and for him was a mother who was a slave, and for him was wealth that his mother should be bought from his wealth and the remainder be handed over to her when there do not happen to be any (other) relatives who have a (legislated) share in the Book (Quran)’.
en.sarwar: 7. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn Mahbub from ‘Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has stated this about the judgment of ’ Amir al-Mu’minin. It is about the case of a man who dies leaving behind a mother, who is owned by someone and a certain amount of assets. He (the Imam) has said, ‘His mother must be bought with his legacy and the rest of the legacy must be given to her, if there are no other relatives who have ordained shares according to the book.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/221)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنْ أَبِي ثَابِتٍ عَنْ حَنَانِ بْنِ سَدِيرٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي يَعْفُورٍ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ

text: مَاتَ مَوْلًى لِعَلِيٍّ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ انْظُرُوا هَلْ تَجِدُونَ لَهُ وَارِثاً فَقِيلَ لَهُ إِنَّ لَهُ بِنْتَيْنِ بِالْيَمَامَةِ مَمْلُوكَتَيْنِ فَاشْتَرَاهُمَا مِنْ مَالِ الْمَيِّتِ ثُمَّ دَفَعَ إِلَيْهِمَا بَقِيَّةَ الْمَالِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazal Bin Shazaan, from Abu Sabit, from Hanan Bin Sudeyr, from Ibn Abu Yafour, from Is’haq Bin Ammar who said,

‘A slave of Ali<sup>asws</sup> died, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Look around, do you find an inheritor for him?’ So it was said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘For him are two daughters at Al-Yamama, both slaves’. So he<sup>asws</sup> bought them both from the wealth of the deceased, then handed over to both of them the remainder of the wealth’.
en.sarwar: 8. Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan from abu Thabit from Hanan ibn Sadir from ibn abu Ya’fur from Ishaq ibn ‘Ammar who has narrated the following: “Once, a Mawla (slave) of Ali, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, died. He said, ‘You must find out if there is anyone who inherits him.’ It was said that he has two daughters who are owned in Yamamah. He (the Imam) bought them from the assets of the deceased and gave to them the rest of the legacy.’” [Note: The next several passages of the Arabic text are the words of Fadl ibn Shadhan and are not translated.]
